name: Easy HRH Princess Margaret Trivia Quiz | U.K. Royals | 10 Questions

questions.text: What relation was Princess Margaret to Queen Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation:
Sister.

	She was the Queen's younger sister.

questions.text: As a girl Princess Margaret was also known by her middle name, which is what?
questions.explanation:
Rose.

	She was known as Princess Margaret Rose.

questions.text: Why did Princess Margaret not marry her first love, royal equerry Peter Townsend?
questions.explanation:
He was divorced.

	Peter Townsend was divorced, although he was the innocent party. This led to a constitutional and moral debate, and finally Margaret decided not to marry him.

Anthony Armstrong-Jones.

	She married Anthony Armstrong-Jones, who was created Earl of Snowdon, and she became Countess of Snowdon.

questions.text: In what branch of the arts had her husband made his name?
questions.explanation:
Photography.

	He is a successful photographer who now works under his title, 'Snowdon'. He also designed the arena for the installation of Prince Charles as Prince of Wales.

questions.text: What is the title used by Princess Margaret's son?
questions.explanation:
Earl of Snowdon.

	David, 2nd Earl of Snowden, has followed his father into the arts, working as a furniture designer. His sister, Lady Sarah Chatto, is also an artist.

questions.text: Of which of the arts was Princess Margaret primarily a patron?
questions.explanation:
Ballet.

	Before the marriage of Prince Charles to Diana, Princess Margaret was the Royal family's leading ballet supporter.

questions.text: On which island did Princess Margaret have a holiday home?
questions.explanation:
Mustique.

	She spent many holidays on Mustique with her friends Lord and Lady Glenconner and other socialites.

questions.text: Which of the following unhealthy habits did Princess Margaret practice?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	She had a long history of poor health, made worse when she badly scalded her feet and legs in an overheated bath in the 1990s.

questions.text: Where did Princess Margaret spend Christmas 2000?
options: On a state visit to France
questions.explanation:
in bed.

	She was ill in bed, unable to eat. She was admitted to hospital in the New Year and it is thought she had suffered a stroke.
